derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin (casus) dativus ('case) of giving', from dat- 'given', from the verb dare

entry.tran: 与格(拉丁语等语言中名词作为动词的间接宾语或某些介词的宾语的形式)
entry.def: In the grammar of some languages, for example Latin, the dative, or the dative case, is the case used for a noun when it is the indirect object of a verb, or when it comes after some prepositions

means.word_mean: 1. the category of nouns serving as the indirect object of a verb

auth_sentence.content: The act of talking to someone is governed by the Dative case.
